title: Ambulance
description: You gain an ambulance, a cagey ride.

outcomes.text: Frame: truck, massive=3, 2-armor. Impression: flashing, wailing, armored, impatient. Impulse: protect what it carries. Defiance: pick its own path.

title: Guardian Angel
description: When you kneel over someone who has fallen, you and they both get +2armor.

title: Healing Touch (+Weird)
description: Put your hands on someone injured and roll+Weird.

bullets: Your touch takes their pain away.
Your touch heals their tissue damage and stops their bleeding.
Your touch knits their bones back together.
Your touch removes their disease or purges their infection.

outcomes.text: Choose 2 …and ask the MC whether they heal 1-harm or 2-harm.
You take their pain away, but they heal 0-harm.
When someone is unconscious in your care, you can use them as a psychic antenna for **augury**.
When someone dies in your care, you can use their body as a psychic antenna for **augury**.

title: Sixth Sense (+Sharp)
description: At the beginning of the session, roll+Sharp.

outcomes.text: Hold 3. Any time during the session, spend 1 of your hold to ask the MC what your sixth sense is telling you. The MC should answer with a warning, an assurance, a clue, or an insight of some kind.
Your sixth sense makes you paranoid and mistrustful. Choose another player's character and take -1 to your Hx with them.

title: Supplier (Requires Angel Kit)
description: You have a supplier, an NPC who somehow has a line on medical supplies. At the beginning of the session, restore 1 of your angel kit's spent stock. Tell the MC to create this person as a **reliable**, your choice of:

title: Stock
description:
Before you begin play, mark 20 of the above stock as *spent*.

**To use your angel kit,** spend it's stock: choose 0-3 suitable supplies and mark them *spent*.  Roll + Stock spent.

title: In the field (+Stock Spent)
description: When someone's suffered harm, it doesn't matter how much, even if their life is untenable, you might be able to help. Roll+stock spent.

bullets: You stabilize them and put them under. You can transport them and take them into your care.
You get them back on their feet. You haven't helped them, just put them back into the action.

outcomes.text: You can't get them back on their feet, but you can stabilize them, as above.
There's not much you can do. Choose 1:
bullets: You ready them for transport, but you can't stabilize them and they suffer 1-harm more.
You do your best for them, break it to them compassionately, and stay with them.

title: In your care (+Stock Spent)
description:
To treat a PC who's past 6:00, or an NPC who's suffered more than 1-harm, roll+stock spent. On any hit, you stabilize them (if they weren't) and heal them — to 6:00 for a PC, outright for an NPC.

However:

bullets: They fight you and you have to chillstab them to hell. You choose: how long will they be out?
The pain and drugs make them babble the truth to you. Ask their player what they spill.
They respond very well to treatment. They heal to 3:00 instead of to 6:00.
They don't need as much care as you expected. Restore 1 spent stock, if you spent any.
They're at your complete mercy. What do you do to them?
The course of their treatment and recovery teaches you something about your craft. Mark XP.
They owe you for your time, attention, and supplies, and you're going to hold it over them.

outcomes.text: No matter what you hoped to do for them, they take 1-harm instead.

title: Restock your angel kit
description: you must restock it supply by supply: by **dropping jingle** in a marketplace, if the supply you need is available there; when you **live day to day**, if the supply you need is free or easy for you to come by; or by scavenging, scrounging, or looting, at the MC's discretion.

title: Improvements
description: Choose 2 Angel moves. At 6Xp, choose an improvement and erase.
pick: Get a new Angel move (Mark it above)
Get a new Angel move (Mark it above)
Get a new Angel move (Mark it above)
Get a following and devotion (Mark it *below*)
Get a move from an unused playbook (Mark it *below*)
Get a move from an unused playbook (Mark it *below*)

bullets: Clothing you detail, including at your option a piece worth 1-armor.
A prosthesis or aid, if you choose.
Living space and incidentals you detail, suitable to your personal needs, scavenge, hard zone, and moves.
